list.title: Implementation of ISO 27001 ISMS in an industrial group
list.summary: We supported a holding company with operations in Chile and Peru in implementing and certifying ISO 27001, strengthening its information security management in record time.
list.description: Cyberhub guided a holding company with presence in Chile and Peru through the full implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS), achieving ISO 27001 certification in less than 9 months.
list.content:
Transforming information security in an industrial group

Cyberhub led the implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS) based on the ISO/IEC 27001:2022 standard for a holding company operating in Chile and Peru. The project aimed to strengthen data protection processes and foster an organizational security culture.

Initial challenge

The organization was undergoing rapid growth and needed to standardize its security controls for audits and regulatory requirements. It had multiple business units with different levels of security maturity and fragmented document management.

Approach and methodology

  • Initial maturity diagnosis based on ISO 27001 Gap Assessment.
  • Risk identification and treatment according to ISO 27005.
  • Design and implementation of technical and organizational policies, procedures, and controls.
  • Training for over 200 employees on information security best practices.
  • Internal audit simulations to ensure compliance before certification.

Results achieved

In less than 9 months, the holding company achieved ISO 27001 certification at a corporate level, consolidating its position with international clients and improving operational efficiency. Security incidents were reduced by 45%, and a permanent security committee was established.

“Cyberhub’s support was key in aligning our security strategy with our business objectives. Today we have a mature, sustainable, and certified ISMS.”
— IT Manager, Industrial Group

Lessons learned

The project demonstrated that implementing an effective ISMS requires both executive commitment and active participation from operational areas. Integration between technology, processes, and people was essential to success.

Want to certify your organization under ISO 27001? Contact us →

list.title: Gap assessment and compliance with Law 21.633 (OIV)
list.summary: We identified compliance gaps with Law 21.633 for an energy company, developing an action plan based on the NIST CSF framework and governance best practices.
list.description: We helped an energy sector company identify its compliance gaps regarding Law 21.633 requirements and develop its action plan based on the NIST CSF framework.
list.content:
Compliance assessment with Law 21.633 in an energy company

A Chilean energy company requested Cyberhub to assess its level of compliance with Law 21.633, which regulates Organizations of Vital Importance (OIV). The goal was to establish a clear diagnosis and action plan to achieve the maturity required by authorities.

Context and challenge

The company faced the obligation to adapt to new legal requirements regarding cybersecurity and operational continuity. However, it lacked a structured reference framework to measure readiness against the Government CSIRT guidelines.

Applied methodology

  • Information gathering through interviews and document reviews.
  • Maturity evaluation based on the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF).
  • Gap identification against controls required by Law 21.633 and its technical guidelines.
  • Design of a prioritized action plan with defined milestones and responsibilities.
  • Delivery of executive and technical reports with a compliance roadmap.

Results achieved

The assessment allowed the organization to understand its real maturity level in Risk Management, Critical Asset Protection, and Incident Response. A structured three-phase improvement plan was designed, currently under execution with quarterly monitoring by the Corporate Security Committee.

“Thanks to Cyberhub’s guidance, we translated legal requirements into concrete actions, improving visibility and management of our operational risks.”
— CISO, Energy Company

Next steps

Based on the results, the company began implementing the NIST CSF Framework as the foundation for its corporate cybersecurity management system and strengthened its internal audit process.

Request a compliance assessment for your organization →

list.title: Technical audit and IT security training
list.summary: We conducted a comprehensive IT security audit for a financial institution, complemented by customized training to enhance team resilience.
list.description: We performed a full security audit of a financial institution’s IT infrastructure, accompanied by tailored training sessions for technical and executive teams.
list.content:
Technical audit and cybersecurity capability building

A national financial institution hired Cyberhub to perform a comprehensive audit of its technological infrastructure and later train its technical and executive teams on security best practices.

Initial situation

The organization sought to identify critical vulnerabilities in its IT environment and improve its internal cybersecurity culture. It lacked a continuous review process and a formal training program for its staff.

Project stages

  • Review of architecture and security policies.
  • Penetration testing and vulnerability analysis.
  • Evaluation of controls in servers, networks, and endpoints.
  • Development of a prioritized mitigation plan based on risk level.
  • Design and delivery of technical workshops and executive awareness sessions.

Main findings and improvements

Gaps were detected in patch management, access control, and network segmentation. After executing the action plan, the organization achieved a 60% reduction in critical vulnerabilities and established a quarterly review schedule.

“The audit allowed us to understand our true level of exposure and prioritize cybersecurity investments. The training transformed how our teams think about security.”
— IT Operations Manager, Financial Institution

Final impact

The project not only raised the organization’s technical maturity but also fostered a sustainable culture of cyber resilience, supported by performance metrics and automated internal tracking.

Schedule an IT security audit with our specialists →

list.title: Incident management and cyberattack response plan
list.summary: We developed a comprehensive incident management plan for a healthcare organization, establishing clear response protocols and roles against cyberattacks.
list.description: Cyberhub supported a healthcare organization in developing its incident response plan, defining clear protocols and roles for handling critical threats.
list.content:
Strengthening cyberattack response capabilities in the healthcare sector

Cyberhub partnered with a healthcare organization to design and implement an Information Security Incident Response Plan (ISIRP). The goal was to establish a clear and operational strategy against cyberattacks threatening data availability and confidentiality.

Initial situation

The institution had faced security incidents that temporarily disrupted critical medical systems and records. There were no formal procedures or defined roles for responding to cyber threats, leading to delayed reactions and dependence on third parties.

Methodology and approach

  • Initial maturity diagnosis of the incident management process.
  • Design of the response workflow based on NIST 800-61r2 (Computer Security Incident Handling Guide).
  • Definition of roles and responsibilities within the Internal Incident Response Team (CSIRT).
  • Implementation of a centralized event logging and tracking system.
  • Incident simulations to validate reaction times and communication flow.

Results and benefits

The organization reduced its detection and containment times for critical incidents by over 50%. Standardized procedures and automated escalation by severity level were established. The response plan was also integrated with business continuity and cyber resilience policies.

“We now have a clear structure to respond to any cyberattack. Cyberhub’s preparation and support made a real difference in our response capability.”
— Technology Director, Healthcare Organization

Key lessons

The experience showed that organizational preparedness and effective internal communication are crucial for successful incident management. Beyond technology, the human factor was key to building a resilient response.

Next steps

The plan includes biannual simulations and the adoption of a SIEM platform to enhance early threat detection. Cyberhub continues to support the client in ongoing process improvement.

Strengthen your organization’s incident management →

certificationsPage.intro: At Cyberhub, we support organizations in the implementation and certification of international ISO standards, ensuring continuous improvement, regulatory compliance, and digital trust. Below are our most relevant certifications, organized by management area.

categories.descripcion: Certifications focused on data protection, IT service management, and organizational cyber resilience.

list.title: ISO/IEC 27001:2022
list.description: Information security management based on international standards.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 27001:2022 is the most recognized international standard for implementing an Information Security Management System (ISMS). Its goal is to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information through a risk-based approach.

Objective

Establish a comprehensive framework for managing information security risks, protecting digital assets, and ensuring regulatory compliance.

Scope

Applicable to any organization handling sensitive information, including financial, technology, healthcare, and critical service entities.

Implementation Time

4 to 6 months, depending on the organization’s maturity level and size.

Cyberhub Proposal

We handle the entire certification process in an integrated, methodological, and proactive way, considering people, processes, and technology. Includes:

  • Initial Gap Analysis.
  • ISMS Implementation.
  • Internal Audit.
  • Training and awareness plan.
  • Certification body management.
  • Post external audit findings management.
  • Integration with other ISO systems (9001, 20000-1, 45001, etc.).

list.title: ISO/IEC 20000-1
list.description: IT Service Management (ITSM) focused on quality, efficiency, and continuous improvement.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 20000-1 sets the requirements for a Service Management System (SMS) that ensures the efficient and high-quality delivery of IT services, aligned with business objectives and customer needs.

Objective

  • Ensure reliable and high-quality IT service delivery.
  • Improve operational efficiency through standardized processes.
  • Strengthen customer satisfaction and risk management.

Scope

  • Applicable to any organization managing IT services internally (IT departments) or externally (providers, outsourcing, cloud).

Implementation Time

2 to 6 months, depending on complexity and number of processes involved.

Cyberhub Proposal

We manage the certification process comprehensively, methodologically, and with a human approach. Includes:

  • Initial Gap Analysis.
  • SMS Implementation.
  • Internal Audit.
  • Training and improvement plan.
  • Certification body management.
  • Post external audit management.
  • Integration with ISO/IEC 27001:2022.

list.title: ISO/IEC 42001
list.description: Responsible and secure management of Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 42001 is the first certifiable international standard defining requirements for an Artificial Intelligence Management System (AIMS). Its purpose is to ensure ethical, transparent, and secure development, implementation, and use of AI.

Objective

Ensure organizations design, develop, and use AI systems responsibly, minimizing ethical, legal, and operational risks.

Scope

Applicable to tech companies, AI startups, research institutions, and organizations using AI in critical or decision-making processes.

Implementation Time

6 months, including diagnosis, implementation, training, and certification preparation phases.

Cyberhub Proposal

We provide comprehensive support, ensuring knowledge transfer to the organization. Includes:

  • Gap Analysis and AIMS planning.
  • Design of ethical policies and controls.
  • System implementation.
  • Internal audit and findings management.
  • Preparation for external certification.

list.title: ISO/IEC 37301
list.description: Compliance Management System (CMS) promoting corporate integrity and ethics.
list.content:
ISO/IEC 37301 establishes the requirements for implementing an effective Compliance Management System (CMS), helping organizations prevent, detect, and respond to noncompliance, strengthening governance and integrity.

Objective

Build a corporate culture of compliance and transparency that reduces legal, financial, and reputational risks.

Scope

Recommended for public or private organizations operating in regulated environments or seeking to strengthen their ethical and control framework.

Cyberhub Proposal

We implement the CMS comprehensively and in integration with other ISO systems, ensuring compliance efficiency and sustainability.

list.title: TISAX
list.description: Information security assessment for the automotive industry.
list.content:
TISAX (Trusted Information Security Assessment Exchange) is a European standard based on ISO/IEC 27001, developed by the German Association of the Automotive Industry (VDA), ensuring information security across the automotive supply chain.

Objective

Assess and certify information security among automotive suppliers and partners, ensuring the protection of confidential data and intellectual property.

Scope

Applicable to manufacturers, suppliers (Tier 1 & Tier 2), technology, and design companies in the automotive sector.

list.title: NERC-CIP
list.description: Cybersecurity requirements for protecting critical electric infrastructure.
list.content:
NERC-CIP (North American Electric Reliability Corporation – Critical Infrastructure Protection) defines a set of technical and organizational requirements to ensure the cybersecurity of critical electric infrastructures.

Objective

Protect systems supporting electricity generation, transmission, and distribution against cyber threats.

Scope

Directed at operators, generators, and transmitters of the National Electric System (SEN) and companies with critical energy dependence.

list.title: NIS2
list.description: European Union directive for network and information system security.
list.content:
NIS2 Directive strengthens cybersecurity obligations for companies operating in essential sectors across the European Union, promoting unified risk management and mandatory incident reporting.

Objective

Increase the level of cyber resilience across European organizations and their international partners.

Scope

Companies operating or providing services within the EU, particularly in energy, healthcare, transport, financial, and digital sectors.

list.title: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
list.description: Framework for managing cybersecurity risks in organizations.
list.content:
NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) provides guidelines and controls to manage and reduce cyber risks in any organization, based on five functions: Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, and Recover.

Objective

Provide a flexible approach to strengthen digital security and organizational resilience against threats.

list.title: Cybersecurity Law
list.description: Gap assessment and alignment with ISO/IEC 27001:2022.
list.content:
Law 21.663 on Cybersecurity in Chile establishes specific obligations for Vital Importance Organizations (OIV) and public or private entities providing essential services. Compliance requires policies, controls, and risk management aligned with ISO/IEC 27001:2022.

Objective

Ensure operational resilience and protection of the country’s critical infrastructures against cyber incidents.

list.title: Data Protection Law
list.description: Assessment and adaptation to the Personal Data Protection Law.
list.content:
The new Personal Data Protection Law in Chile modernizes the regulatory framework, strengthening individual rights and organizational obligations regarding personal data processing.

Objective

Support organizations in regulatory adaptation and implementation of privacy and security policies aligned with ISO/IEC 27001:2022.

list.title: Gap Analysis

Initial gap and maturity diagnosis

Main activities

  • Review of existing policies, processes, and controls.
  • Interviews with key area leaders.
  • Comparison with Annex A requirements.
  • Detailed report with findings and action plan.

Benefits

  • Complete visibility of the current ISMS state.
  • Effective prioritization of improvement actions.
  • Solid foundation for certification planning.

Added value

Provides a strategic view to focus efforts and resources where they truly generate compliance impact.

list.content:
Initial gap and maturity assessment

The Gap Analysis evaluates your organization’s current situation against the requirements of ISO/IEC 27001:2022, detecting deviations and defining a prioritized roadmap to achieve full compliance.

Main activities

  • Review of existing policies, processes, and controls.
  • Interviews with key area representatives.
  • Comparison with Annex A requirements.
  • Detailed report with findings and action plan.

Benefits

  • Complete visibility of the current ISMS state.
  • Effective prioritization of improvement actions.
  • Solid foundation for certification planning.

Added value

Provides a strategic perspective to focus efforts and resources where they truly generate compliance impact.

list.title: ISMS Implementation
list.description: We design and implement your Information Security Management System (ISMS) tailored to your organization’s reality and in accordance with ISO/IEC 27001:2022.
list.content:
Structured ISMS Implementation

We guide your organization through the design, documentation, and complete implementation of the Information Security Management System under the ISO/IEC 27001:2022 standard, ensuring alignment between processes, technology, and people.

Key components

  • Definition of ISMS scope and objectives.
  • Risk management per ISO/IEC 27005.
  • Development of policies, controls, and procedures.
  • Support for technical and documentation implementation.

Expected results

  • Operational and auditable ISMS across all critical areas.
  • Integration of security into organizational strategy.
  • Effective preparation for certification audits.

Strategic value

A well-implemented ISMS not only complies with the standard but strengthens digital resilience and builds market trust.

list.title: Internal ISMS Audit
list.description: We conduct internal audits to assess compliance, effectiveness, and improvement opportunities before the external audit process.
list.content:
Internal audits with added value

We objectively evaluate the effectiveness of your ISMS to ensure it complies with ISO/IEC 27001:2022, identifying nonconformities, deviations, and improvement opportunities before the external audit.

Scope

  • Document and technical control review.
  • Interviews and evidence verification.
  • Detection of deviations and action planning.
  • Comprehensive audit report with recommendations.

Benefits

  • Early identification of gaps before certification.
  • Continuous improvement of the ISMS.
  • Enhanced readiness for external audits.

list.title: Awareness and Training Management
list.description: We design training programs and awareness campaigns to strengthen your organization’s security culture and regulatory compliance.
list.content:
Building a security culture through people

The success of any management system depends on human commitment. We develop awareness and training programs adapted to each organizational level, promoting safe behavior and compliance with regulations.

Program elements

  • Role- and area-based training.
  • Phishing simulations and awareness campaigns.
  • Effectiveness assessments and change metrics.

Impact

  • Increased digital responsibility and awareness.
  • Reduction of human errors.
  • Compliance with ISO/IEC 27001, control A.7.2.

list.title: Certification Body Management
list.description: We support your organization during the certification process, coordinating audits and managing communication with the certification body.
list.content:
Certification support and coordination

During the final phase of the project, Cyberhub coordinates with accredited certification bodies, ensuring a smooth audit process and successful ISO/IEC 27001:2022 certification.

Activities

  • Pre-audit preparation and document support.
  • Communication management with external auditors.
  • Technical assistance during the audit.

Benefits

  • Efficient and uninterrupted certification process.
  • Minimized findings during external audits.
  • Full compliance with ISO requirements.

list.title: Post External Audit Findings Management
list.description: We help manage and close findings detected after external audits, ensuring continuous ISMS improvement.
list.content:
Closing findings and continuous improvement

After the external audit, we provide specialized support to manage and resolve nonconformities, reinforcing ISMS maturity and long-term sustainability.

Typical actions

  • Classification and prioritization of findings.
  • Design of corrective action plans.
  • Verification and documentation of effective closures.

Benefits

  • Recurrence prevention.
  • System maturity and continuous improvement.
  • Increased confidence for future audits.

list.title: Annual System Maintenance
list.description: We provide continuous support and periodic audits to keep your ISMS updated, effective, and compliant.
list.content:
ISMS maintenance and review

We offer post-certification support to ensure the ISMS remains effective, adapting to technological, regulatory, and organizational changes.

Included services

  • Annual internal audits.
  • Risk matrix updates.
  • Ongoing staff training.
  • Documentation and technical support.

Advantages

  • Ensures sustained ISMS compliance.
  • Prevents control degradation.
  • Simplifies certification renewals.

list.title: Integration with Other Management Systems
list.description: We integrate your ISMS with ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001, or other management systems, optimizing processes and reducing redundancies.
list.content:
Integrated management systems

We facilitate the integration of your ISMS with other management systems such as ISO 9001 (Quality), ISO 14001 (Environmental), and ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and Safety), allowing synergy across processes and controls.

Benefits

  • Reduced audit efforts and costs.
  • Unified view of risks and performance.
  • Greater consistency in corporate policies.

Results

  • More agile and aligned processes.
  • Improved traceability and control.
  • Higher satisfaction for internal and external clients.

privacyPolicy.title: Data Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: At Cyberhub, we value and respect your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, protect, and share the personal information you provide through our website and services.

sections.heading: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We collect personal information that you provide directly to us, such as your name, email, phone number, or other data necessary to deliver our services or respond to your inquiries.

sections.heading: 2. Use of Information
sections.content: We use the collected information for the following purposes:
list: Respond to your requests or inquiries.
Send relevant communications about our services or events.
Comply with legal or regulatory obligations.

sections.heading: 3. Data Protection
sections.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against loss, unauthorized access, alteration, or disclosure. Only authorized personnel may access this information.

sections.heading: 4. Data Sharing
sections.content: We do not share your personal data with third parties unless:
list: It is necessary to provide the requested service.
There is a legal obligation to do so.

sections.heading: 5. Your Rights
sections.content: You have the right to access, rectify, delete, or restrict the processing of your personal data. You can exercise these rights by writing to contacto@cybertower.cl.

sections.heading: 6. Data Retention
sections.content: We will retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law.

sections.heading: 7. Changes to This Policy
sections.content: Cyberhub reserves the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. Updates will be published on this page along with their effective date.

sections.heading: 8. Contact
sections.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or about the use of your personal data, please contact us at contacto@cybertower.cl.
